raw_response:
Harimi (also spelled Haraimi or Hraime) is visually a **rich, spicy stew with a deep red to reddish-brown color**, primarily due to its tomato and harissa base. It has a **saucy, stew-like consistency**—not watery like a soup but not solid like a dry dish. The sauce is thick enough to coat pieces of fish or tofu but still fluid and flavorful.

When served, Harimi is typically presented **in a shallow, wide serving dish or bowl** that accommodates the saucy nature of the dish and makes the pieces
